item.title: Thanks to ownage plz for ALOT of help, my question is answered
item.dc:creator: @ownage_plz ownage plz
item.description:
@ownage_plz wrote:

People shouldn’t flame people for asking questions. Atleast not for asking a question that isn’t tooo dumb also …

I already have it so if you use the item on the object it teles you

Atleast you tried yourself before you posted unlike some people who just post and expect to have it handed to them on a silver platter.

Just put it in “public void objectClick” under that switch just add this part of it.

case 1722: if(playerHasItem(2418)) { teleportToX = cordx; teleportToY = cordy; } else { sendMessage("You need a bronze key to enter"); } break;

item.title: Thanks to ownage plz for ALOT of help, my question is answered
item.dc:creator: @ownage_plz ownage plz
item.description:
@ownage_plz wrote:

switch(objectID) { case 1722: if(playerHasItem(2418)) { teleportToX = cordx; teleportToY = cordy; } else { sendMessage("You need a bronze key to enter"); } break; }

That’s perfect you now know the basics of the switch statement good thing you don’t have to do any of that work except make a case for the object because there should already be a method dealing with clicking on objects in your client

item.title: Thanks to ownage plz for ALOT of help, my question is answered
item.dc:creator: @ownage_plz ownage plz
item.description:
@ownage_plz wrote:

XD It might be easier but isn’t it worth it to learn something new and useful :D.

switch(objectID) { case 1722: { if(playerHasItem(2418)) { teleportToX = cordx; teleportToY = cordy; } else { sendMessage("You need a bronze key to enter"); } break; } }

Thats almost perfect except for the fact that you don’t need the { under the case ####:

and you don’t need the extra brace at the end.

item.description:
@0.o wrote:

edited it right before your post

switch(objectID) { case 1722: { if(playerHasItem(2418)) { teleportToX = cordx; teleportToY = cordy; } else { sendMessage("You need a bronze key to enter"); } break; } }

Read full topic
item.source: Thanks to ownage plz for ALOT of help, my question is answered

item.title: Thanks to ownage plz for ALOT of help, my question is answered
item.dc:creator: @ownage_plz ownage plz
item.description:
@ownage_plz wrote:

[quote=“0.o, post:19, topic:131366”]Damn, this is hard XD

switch(objectID) { case 1722: break; if(playerHasItem(2418)) { teleportToX = cordx; teleportToY = cordy; } else { sendMessage("You need a bronze key to enter"); } break; }

Also I really aprecciate you helping me, and not making fun of me.[/quote]

It’s cool there’s always stuff people don’t know. Now … the problem with this is …

switch(objectID) { case 1722: break; if(playerHasItem(2418)) { teleportToX = cordx; teleportToY = cordy; } else { sendMessage("You need a bronze key to enter"); } break; }

The break ends the case number. Break; is basically the closing brace of the case. Think of case ####: as { and break; as } so therefore everything after that first break you have won’t happen and you’ll probably get an error. Break has to come at the end of a case. But you don’t need to close every case and I showed you above which can come in handy if you want a bunch of different cases to do the same thing like

case ####:
case ####:
case ####:
case ####:
case ####:
case ####:
openUpBank();
break;

All the cases above the break would open up the bank.

Read full topic
item.source: Thanks to ownage plz for ALOT of help, my question is answered

item.title: Thanks to ownage plz for ALOT of help, my question is answered
item.dc:creator: @0.o 0.o
item.description:
@0.o wrote:

Damn, this is hard XD, starting to seem easier to just remind people they have to use the key on the object =(

switch(objectID) { case 1722: { if(playerHasItem(2418)) { teleportToX = cordx; teleportToY = cordy; } else { sendMessage("You need a bronze key to enter"); } break; } }

Also I really aprecciate you helping me, and not making fun of me.

Read full topic

item.title: Thanks to ownage plz for ALOT of help, my question is answered
item.dc:creator: @ownage_plz ownage plz
item.description:
@ownage_plz wrote:

Thats the switch block. AKA the body of the switch statement. Let me show you.

switch(objectID) { //start of switch STATEMENT
case ####://start of switch block
case ####:
case ####:
case ####:
case ####:
break;
default:
break; // end of switch block
}//end of switch STATEMENT

Read full topic

in which case it would be the npc’s npcID get it ?
